data.meanings: to mark/sign/distinguish, creations/beings, world, science/learning/knowledge/information, aware/know. By means of which one knows a thing, hence it signifies world or creation, because by it the Creator is known. alim (pl. ulama) - one who is learned/wise or knows.
data.sentence: The word أَعْلَمُ comes from the root ع ل م and is associated with the meanings: to mark/sign/distinguish, creations/beings, world, science/learning/knowledge/information, aware/know. By means of which one knows a thing, hence it signifies world or creation, because by it the Creator is known. alim (pl. ulama) - one who is learned/wise or knows.
The word أَنْتَ comes from the root ا ن ت and is associated with the meanings: you (singular)

data.meanings: to say/speak, to call, to be named, word/speech, utterance, a thing said, greeting, discourse, one who says/speaks. To inspire/transmit/relate/answer/think/profess, emit an opinion on, indicate a state or condition or circumstance. qa'ilun - speaker, indicator.
data.sentence: The word يَقُولُونَ comes from the root ق و ل and is associated with the meanings: to say/speak, to call, to be named, word/speech, utterance, a thing said, greeting, discourse, one who says/speaks. To inspire/transmit/relate/answer/think/profess, emit an opinion on, indicate a state or condition or circumstance. qa'ilun - speaker, indicator.

data.meanings: to promise, give one's word, threaten, promise good, threaten (depending on context).. . Wa'ada act (pr.f 3rd. p. m. sing.): He promised.. Wa'adta (prf. 2nd. p. m. sing.): Thou promised.. Wa'adtu (prf. 1st. p. m. sing.): I promised.. Wa'aduu (prf. 3rd. p. plu.): They promised.. Wa'adna  (prf. 1st. p. m.): We promise.. Ya'idu (imp. 3rd. p. m. sing.): He promises, threatens.. 'Id (prt. m. sing.): promise.. Wu'ida (pp. 3rd. p. sing.): Has been promised.. Yuu'aduuna (pip. 3rd. p. plu.): They were threatened.. Tu'aduuna  (pip. 2nd. p. plu.) You are promised, are threatened.. Mau'uud (pic. pact. n. sing.): Promised.. Tuu'aduuna  (imp. 2nd. p. m. plu. II.): (Punishment which) you are promised.. Waa'adna (imp. 1st. p. plu. III.): We made an appointment, a promise.. Tawaa'dtum (prf. 2nd. p. m. plu.): Ye have mutually appointed.. Laa Tawaa'duu  (prt. neg. m.plu.): Do not appoint mutually; Make no agreement or promises.. Wa'iid (act. 2nd. pic. m. sing.): Threatening; Threat; Warning.. Mau'idan (n. place): Time; Place or time of the fulfilment of a prediction; Promise or warning; Appointment for meeting a promise.. Mii'aad  (for Miu'aad; n. place): Time; Time or place of the promise.

Yuu'aduuna (pip. 3rd. p. plu.): They were threatened.. Tu'aduuna  (pip. 2nd. p. plu.) You are promised, are threatened.. Mau'uud (pic. pact. n. sing.): Promised.. Tuu'aduuna  (imp. 2nd. p. m. plu. II.): (Punishment which) you are promised.. Waa'adna (imp. 1st. p. plu. III.): We made an appointment, a promise.. Tawaa'dtum (prf. 2nd. p. m. plu.): Ye have mutually appointed.. Laa Tawaa'duu  (prt. neg. m.plu.): Do not appoint mutually; Make no agreement or promises.. Wa'iid (act. 2nd. pic. m. sing.): Threatening; Threat; Warning.. Mau'idan (n. place): Time; Place or time of the fulfilment of a prediction; Promise or warning; Appointment for meeting a promise.. data.meanings: To fear, to be afraid/frightened/terrified, to put fear into another, diminish or lessen or take from, to take little by little from a thing, take from the sides of a thing, slaughter or fight.
data.sentence: The word يَخَافُ comes from the root خ و ف and is associated with the meanings: To fear, to be afraid/frightened/terrified, to put fear into another, diminish or lessen or take from, to take little by little from a thing, take from the sides of a thing, slaughter or fight.

data.meanings: to recite/read, compilation, collection, reading, recitation, explanation, study, investigation.
data.sentence: The word بِالْقُرْءَانِ comes from the root ق ر ا and is associated with the meanings: to recite/read, compilation, collection, reading, recitation, explanation, study, investigation.

data.meanings: To reduce from a fractured state, or restore from a state of poverty to sufficiency. Set or reduced from a fractured state. "A poor man being likened to one who has a broken bone and his restoration to wealth being likened to the setting of the bone." Compell, constrain, incite, urge, or induce another [against his will]. Addition of something for the purpose of reparation [in computation]. Self-magnification, pride, haughtiness, insolence, bold, audacious, inordinate, tyrannical, overbearing, extravagent. A king. "There has been no prophetic office but a kingly office has succeeded in its place through someone's self-magnification, pride, haughtiness, or insolence." Slave, servant. No retaliation or expiatory mulct exacted [for a thing/person]. Tall, above the reach of the hand, ascend [the palm tree that grows tall for the cutting of its fruit], and retaining excellence.
data.sentence: The word بِجَبَّارٍ comes from the root ج ب ر and is associated with the meanings: To reduce from a fractured state, or restore from a state of poverty to sufficiency. Set or reduced from a fractured state. "A poor man being likened to one who has a broken bone and his restoration to wealth being likened to the setting of the bone." Compell, constrain, incite, urge, or induce another [against his will]. Addition of something for the purpose of reparation [in computation]. Self-magnification, pride, haughtiness, insolence, bold, audacious, inordinate, tyrannical, overbearing, extravagent. A king. "There has been no prophetic office but a kingly office has succeeded in its place through someone's self-magnification, pride, haughtiness, or insolence." Slave, servant. No retaliation or expiatory mulct exacted [for a thing/person]. Tall, above the reach of the hand, ascend [the palm tree that grows tall for the cutting of its fruit], and retaining excellence.

data.meanings: to remember/commemorate/recollect, study in order to remember, remind, bear in mind, mindful, mention/tell/relate, magnify/praise, admonish/warn (e.g. dhikra is the 2nd declenation and it is stronger than dhikr), preach, extol, give status.nobility/eminence/honour, fame, good report, cause of good reputation, means of exaltation.Male/man/masculine (dhakar, dual - dhakarain, plural - dhukur).
data.sentence: The word فَذَكِّرْ comes from the root ذ ك ر and is associated with the meanings: to remember/commemorate/recollect, study in order to remember, remind, bear in mind, mindful, mention/tell/relate, magnify/praise, admonish/warn (e.g. dhikra is the 2nd declenation and it is stronger than dhikr), preach, extol, give status.nobility/eminence/honour, fame, good report, cause of good reputation, means of exaltation.Male/man/masculine (dhakar, dual - dhakarain, plural - dhukur).
